name: Invesco S&P 500 Low Volatility Index ETF
longDescription: ULV seeks to replicate, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of the S&P 500 Low Volatility Index, or any successor thereto, on an unhedged basis, in the case of any unhedged units, or on a hedged basis, in the case of any hedged units. In order to achieve its investment objective, ULV currently holds securities of Invesco S&P 500 Low Volatility ETF (NYSE Arca ticker: SPLV). Invesco S&P 500 Low Volatility ETF seeks investment results that correspond (before fees and expenses) generally to the price and yield of the S&P 500 Low Volatility Index.
fulldescription: ULV seeks to replicate, to the extent reasonably possible and before fees and expenses, the performance of the S&P 500 Low Volatility Index, or any successor thereto, on an unhedged basis, in the case of any unhedged units, or on a hedged basis, in the case of any hedged units. In order to achieve its investment objective, ULV currently holds securities of Invesco S&P 500 Low Volatility ETF (NYSE Arca ticker: SPLV). Invesco S&P 500 Low Volatility ETF seeks investment results that correspond (before fees and expenses) generally to the price and yield of the S&P 500 Low Volatility Index. While ULV holds securities of SPLV, the reported performance of ULV and SPLV will not be the same, primarily because: (i) each of ULV and SPLV has its own fees and expenses, which will affect returns (in the case of ULV, this includes the cost of the currency forwards used to hedge the foreign currency exposure of the portion of the portfolio attributable to its CAD Hedged Units back to the Canadian dollar); (ii) ULV may not be able to fully hedge the foreign currency exposure of the portion of the portfolio attributable to its CAD Hedged Units at all times; and (iii) ULV may incur withholding taxes from the income it receives from SPLV, which is listed on a U.S. exchange.
fullAddress: 5140 Yonge Street, Suite 900, Toronto, Ontario, CA
